Package org.lgdcloudsim.statemanager

Interface StatesManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
StatesManagerSimple
public interface StatesManager
An interface to manage the states of the datacenter. It records all host states in the datacenter, the partition information, and is responsible for allocating instances and releasing resources occupied by instances. It also provides the ability to synchronize the state to the intra-scheduler and inter-scheduler. To synchronize the state to the intra-scheduler, it records the changed host states during the synchronization gap and the independent scheduled host states of every intra-scheduler. To synchronize the state to the inter-scheduler, it records the simple overall state information of hosts in an entire datacenter, see SimpleState. Additionally, it provides the ability to predict the future state of the datacenter, see PredictionManager. It also provides the ability to record the power-on time of the hosts in the datacenter, see DatacenterPowerOnRecord. It also manages the schedule view of every intra-scheduler.
Since:
LGDCloudSim 1.0
Author:
Anonymous

      StatesManager initHostStates(int cpu, int ram, int storage, int bw, int startId, int length)
      Get the host states in the datacenter.

      ram - the ram capacity of the host.
      storage - the storage capacity of the host.
      bw - the bw capacity of the host.
      startId - the start id of the host.
      length - the number of hosts that has the same capacity.

      the StatesManager itself.

    • revertHostState

      StatesManager revertHostState(IntraSchedulerResult intraSchedulerResult)
      Revert the host state according to the schedule result. If the IntraScheduler synchronizes a certain partition during the period InnerScheduleBegin~InnerScheduleEnd, it will clear all the selfHostStates in this area, and the scheduler actually thinks that it has successfully scheduled itself, so we need to use the IntraScheduler's The scheduling result restores selfHostState.
      Parameters:
      intraSchedulerResult - the intra-scheduler result.
      Returns:
      the StatesManager itself.

    • revertSelfHostState

      StatesManager revertSelfHostState(List<Instance> instances, IntraScheduler intraScheduler)
      Revert the host state recorded for intra-scheduler independently. After the intra-scheduler allocates an instance to a host, it will update the state of the host to the state that the instance is allocated successfully. But when some instances are allocated failed later, we need to revert the host state to the state before the instance is allocated.
      Parameters:
      instances - the instances to be reverted.
      intraScheduler - the intra-scheduler.
      Returns:
      the StatesManager itself.

    • getSynState

      SynState getSynState(IntraScheduler intraScheduler)
      get the synchronization state of the intra-scheduler.
      Parameters:
      intraScheduler - the intra-scheduler.
      Returns:
      the synchronization state of the intra-scheduler, see SynState.

    • isSynCostTime

      boolean isSynCostTime()
      Whether the synchronization takes time in the data center for the intra-scheduler. If it doesn't take time, it means that the scheduler is state-aware in real time.
      Returns:
      whether the synchronization takes time.
